intro: Pycnarrhena, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plants are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive appearance and ease of care. Pycnarrhena species typically thrive in warm, humid environments with bright, indirect light. They are popular in horticulture for their ability to bloom throughout the year under proper conditions.
